args.justification: All these relations connect biotic/abiotic subjects (birds, bird populations, habitats, ecosystems) to ecosystem services (pest control, general ecosystem services). Some express direct provision (provides_ecosystem_service) while others express indirect enabling/support (supports_ecosystem_services). The current rel_cls 'ecosystem_service_provision_relation' is too narrow for the support/enablement cases. A more general class 'ecosystem_service_relation' can consistently cover both direct provision and indirect support while keeping the rel_cls_group as FUNCTION.
args.remark: Normalized the relation class so both provision- and support-type ecosystem service predicates fall under a single, more general ecosystem_service_relation umbrella.

executed_decisions.justification: All these relations connect biotic/abiotic subjects (birds, bird populations, habitats, ecosystems) to ecosystem services (pest control, general ecosystem services). Some express direct provision (provides_ecosystem_service) while others express indirect enabling/support (supports_ecosystem_services). The current rel_cls 'ecosystem_service_provision_relation' is too narrow for the support/enablement cases. A more general class 'ecosystem_service_relation' can consistently cover both direct provision and indirect support while keeping the rel_cls_group as FUNCTION.
executed_decisions.remark: Normalized the relation class so both provision- and support-type ecosystem service predicates fall under a single, more general ecosystem_service_relation umbrella.
